subtitle: Hello everyone, this is Gene, and welcome back to Astral Aoorway. First i'd like to thank all of
the new subscribers, I've only been making videos for just over a month now and we already have 600
so that's great, that's more than i expected, as a result we also have a custom IRL for the channel now
which is: www.youtube.com/c/astraldoorway so if you want to share this
channel anywhere for anyone interested in astral projection and you think they'll benefit from
my rambling you can use the new link, i'll put that in the description below as well
and also sorry that the videos aren't as often at the moment i've just moved to seoul in south korea
where i'll be living for the foreseeable future so i'm in a bit of an adjusting period at the
moment but it's really an interesting country out here with great people and great food so
i'm very excited to get out of quarantine which i'm currently in, but on the positive
side quarantine has given me that secluded time to finish up my book which will be published in a few
days a few of you requested that i make a video for that explaining you know what it's about and
stuff so i'll be releasing a video on that too in a few days as well, yeah so i've been very busy
so let's get to it, this video will be on how to turn your dreams
or lucid dreams into astral projection okay? how to astral project from the dream state
now i will provide a specific method on how to do this but first and foremost there is a superior
way of understanding this - a superior method you could say and it derives purely from
understanding your dream state while in the dream and instinctively going beyond it okay?
this is something that not a lot of people seem to understand; they only seek any kind of step-by-step
method as if there is some kind of button you can find in a dream that will just say "oh if i press
this it's going to turn into actual projection" um but it goes deeper you know we have to think
and contemplate critically about this - about how to escape the illusions and hallucinations
that you're seeing in your mind during the dream okay? so you know in other words...
whenever you find yourself in a lucid dream you have to realize that in fact
you are essentially creating the dream right? i mean who else is creating it it's simply you
and your subconscious mind and through practicing meditation and introspection we can
develop a better clarity over this and understand it more directly, but for now here whilst we're
playing with these ideas i'm just going to try and explain to you how we comprehend this
so imagine that you're in a lucid dream, you can simply learn to feel
that you're thinking or imagining all the scenes in front of you, and what happens when you
successfully feel yourself doing this? well then you can naturally stop the content of the dream
from happening, okay? just in the same way that you can stop your thoughts in waking life
have you ever been walking down the street and you realize that you're thinking random thoughts
that you didn't want to or perhaps you had a song in your head? and you know just by choice just by
being conscious you can stop doing that and direct your attention to something else - this is really
not that much different from when we're in a dream so, whilst we're in the dream and we stop dreaming
what happens when you're in a non-physical dream environment but suddenly stop dreaming? well, your
consciousness has no choice but to enter a more objective reality, in other words you'll naturally
enter the astral plane, you know your physical body is still fast asleep during this time
and so it's just a matter of what we do with our perception or level of consciousness
during all of this, even meditating within a dream can simply turn it into actual projection as well
assuming that you're a good meditator and understand the principles of going beyond our
thoughts and perceptions that present themselves to you in our consciousness - that takes practice
but yes so this is it in essence really you know? you need to break the dream to go beyond
the narrative of the dream to do this whenever you find yourself lucid in a dream
simply look around and try to sense the innate feeling of how your mind is creating the scenes
once you recognize and feel yourself creating these scenes in your mind, then it becomes
naturally easier to stop them - essentially we're doing the same as when we suddenly snap out
of daydreaming in physical waking life right? it's like when you see someone daydreaming and
you suddenly sneak up on them and scare them and they snap out of the trance right - their attention
becomes more present... so of course all of this goes back to how lucid dreaming and astral projection
is synonymous with the awakening of consciousness; about being in the present moment in order to stop
thinking - to stop dreaming... this takes a bit of practice and intuition to understand of course
but if you want a better elaboration on this i recommend listening to the lucid dreaming vs
astral projection video which is linked on the screen now - i go in
depth there about the difference between these two phenomena it should help you
contemplate and understand the difference more, so when you're in a lucid dream and you intend to
stop the dream entirely this can be done within moments and two things can happen when you do this
one is that you will witness the content of the dream and the objects around you dissolve
before your eyes or disappear literally, and you'll feel a shift in the atmosphere which can include
but is not limited by vibrations and hypnagogic imagery or strange and loud sounds, shortly after
during this transitionary stage, you'll most likely find yourself going straight into an
astral environment and everything about your environment will of course now feel very different
feel more physical more tangible you'll innately know that you're not dreaming anymore and that
you've successfully entered a more objective dimension, which is not being created by your
subconscious mind anymore and you will not have any sense that your subconscious mind
is creating it, if you want to test it out you can try controlling your environment and you will see
that it won't respond in the same way as a dream, so yes if you break the dream
you may see everything disappear and you'll naturally enter another environment
however, on the other hand another thing that can happen is that you may instead go back to
your physical body, but from there you can exit the body as well just one thing to note is that
if you do go back to your physical body with the intention of astral projecting from there
just make sure you don't move your physical body, you know? you can do this simply just by
intending it and remembering it, you know? i'm going back to my body i'm not going to move it
and i'm just going to proceed to go out calmly and progressively, generally speaking anytime we
sit to lay down for formal meditation or astral projection we shouldn't be moving any part of
our bodies just let it settle and become relaxed but don't do this by forcing yourself or straining
yourself you know just relax and let go, now some of you may have found different techniques for
entering the astral from lucid dreams such as creating portals or doorways within a lucid dream
with the intention of going through it and coming out on the other side into a astral environment
this is fine, and it can work, but if you have a lack of intention or lack of understanding
you can still come out on the other side still in a dream state so, you know, those can work
and, you know, we're all different and we all have different methods so personally
that one doesn't work for me as well but it can work for you, but what i'm emphasizing here
is applicable to all these kinds of methods because it's about directly understanding the
process instinctively in our layers of perception of reality and when you understand it in this way
you can easily turn a dream into astral projection anytime without thinking about a method
you simply do it through a state of consciousness, a state of being where you naturally stop yourself
from dreaming so naturally daily meditation and a focus on being present throughout your waking life
is immensely beneficial for this practice because through being present and not dabbling in endless
thoughts and daydreaming throughout your day in waking life, then you'll also stop drowning in
the endless thoughts and dreams in your sleep, as above so below, you know even psychologists
recognize that our dreams at night are often a reflection of what we thought about during the day
well, what if we were to stop thinking during the day and develop a more silent mind?
well then our tendency to be in unconscious dreams are much less likely... when i say
that we think all the time during the day and in our sleep i really mean no different
from dreaming right? thinking and dreaming are pretty much completely synonymous
so with all that said i'll now provide a method for entering the astral plane from dreams
which i naturally discovered and have been doing successfully again and again for a while now, so
step number one achieve lucidity in your dream by any means of the numerous lucid dreaming methods
you can find out there okay? i'm not going to go in depth about lucid dreaming practices because
lucid dreaming is far more widely accepted throughout conventional consensus so you'll
find so many great resources out there if you just have a look, but one of the most effective methods
and the one that i use the most of is reality checks - i personally like the hold nose reality
check which involves me closing my nostrils with my fingers and trying to breathe through
my nose while it shut, if i can breathe through my closed nostrils it means that i'm in a dream
if not then i'm in physical reality, if you make a habit of doing reality checks every day as many
times as you can and if you can keep doing it, you will naturally begin to start doing it in your
dreams as well, it's important to note though that doing reality checks properly and profoundly and
cultivating a sort of ongoing constant reality checking awareness goes a lot deeper too so
i'll be sure to make a video for that as well, so yes the first step is to become lucid now
step number two is once you find yourself lucid in a dream become present, as discussed before
recognize the content of the dream and without much hesitation employ your intent for astral
projection, there's nothing special here simply think about it and while you do this
feel your dream body intensely okay - so just imagine; you're lucid in a dream and you're just
stood there intensely aware of your dream body and now you brace yourself and get ready to go
beyond the dream and astral project, at this point you should feel like a robust rocket about to take
off right because here's the next important part; you need to fly upwards in a fast speed okay?
just fly upwards just look up and go as you do this the higher you get you may begin to feel vibrations,
as you feel yourself traveling upwards, which can be quite intense you may start to see space and stars
simply just continue to intend to keep ascending through higher and higher states of awareness
that is all you need to think about and while you're flying upwards you can also say mentally
"enter the astral plane, enter the astral plane" and as a result of just flying upwards with the
intention of going higher and higher after a period of time you may start to find yourself
in a sort of darkness or void for just a few moments and then eventually you'll find yourself
in a new environment, the difference in clarity and sensation in this new environment should
be amazing, you know, as it always is in astral projection, a kind of hyper realism should come
over you in comparison to the lucid dream that you were just in - this is a wonderful practice
because you directly get to instinctively feel the difference between a dream and astral projection
right? you know everyone always asks the question what's the difference it's really hard to describe
but when you get the experience firsthand, you just know, you know? it's not on the level of
your intellect, that's why it's still hard to describe, but you've acquired the knowledge
of the difference within your being, right? in your heart, you know? so yeah that's it two steps
one become lucid and two fly upwards with strong intentions of going into the astral
plane that's it, and it is quite a fun and exciting practice, because as you're flying upwards i mean
you know you feel like a superman right you just you're flying upwards you can look down and you're
so high up and the sensation of being so high and this sense of heights right? can often induce
the vibrations so there's also a variation of this where you can jump and fall from something
tall, and the sensation of falling can also often induce the hypnagogic vibrationary stage
right? however i prefer the method of flying because there's something about the symbolism,
the metaphor of going upwards right which consciousness seems to respond well to
it's like it somehow understands this as a sort of ascension ~ a mini ascension of our awareness
during this experience so, once you're on the other side in the astral plane
you'll just know instinctively whether you're in the astral or not, or whether you're still dreaming
it's most likely the case that you're not dreaming if you experienced it similar to the
way i described, but if you're still struggling and you still find yourself in a dream state
after all your efforts, then simply just try it again, the fact that you even
recognize that you're still in a dream state is in great progress already, and you know, awakening will
naturally occur with consistent efforts now, if you find yourself going back to your body don't worry
just don't move your physical body and imploy your intention to fly upwards
to leave your body you can do this simply by intending it, if you're struggling
try forcing a sort of "swaying" sensation in your awareness back and forth
right? try to wiggle out of your body if you find yourself stuck this will help you
loosen up out of your physical shell, so to speak, sort of like a chick trying to
roll its egg around in an attempt to crack it open, you know, you have to use a bit of
willpower here, you might find yourself in sleep paralysis, a lot of people find themselves stuck
in sleep paralysis, and in reality they just need willpower in sleep paralysis your physical
body is paralyzed, you can just force yourself out, through sheer force, through sheer intention,
and willpower, there's not that much of a different way to describe it - so there you have it this is one
of the easiest and funnest ways to astral project and enter the astral plane from lucid dreams
because, you know, once you're lucid you're already halfway there right you're already in non-physical
reality and through working with your subconscious you are able to become conscious amidst a
unconscious experience and from there you can either intuitively break the dream, as i said at
the start of the video, or use the flying method and this will give a shock to your consciousness
that is so great that you enter the astral plane, of course all of this should be practiced only
if you have first developed good memory over your dreams, if you're not actively remembering
your dreams yet, then start doing that first because honestly you can have all these
amazing experiences and still not remember them it happens all the time, even to me, so
begin by recalling all your dreams in detail every morning and strengthened this non-physical part of
your psyche - alright so thank you for listening everyone please subscribe if you haven't already
for many more tutorials just like this and if you have any questions at all please feel free to
ask in the comments below, and if you'd like to support the channel through patreon there's
a link in the description below too, so good luck and i wish you many lucid dreams but also
for you to go beyond those dreams and enter the objective reality of the astral plane, thank you
